trans-unit.source: Rental Setup
The setup for cc|rental is performed in pages found in the cc|rental, Administration menu.

seg-source.mrk: The setup for cc|rental is performed in pages found in the cc|rental, Administration menu.

trans-unit.source: Rental Mgt. Setup
The Rental Mgt. Setup page is opened from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > cc|rental > Administration > Rental Mgt. Setup. The following sections explain the fields on this page.

seg-source.mrk: Setup page is opened from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > cc|rental > Administration > Rental Mgt.
The following sections explain the fields on this page.

trans-unit.source: General FastTab
The General FastTab provides the basic settings for cc|rental.

seg-source.mrk: The General FastTab provides the basic settings for cc|rental.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Mgt. Setup page, General FastTab
The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Serv. Contract Acc. Gr. Code
Used for invoicing purposes. The G/L accounts from the selected group are not used but the code is required.

seg-source.mrk: The G/L accounts from the selected group are not used but the code is required.

trans-unit.source: Def. Invt. Post. Setup Location

Used as the default posting group information when creating the inventory posting setup during the automatic creation of customer locations. Refer to topics <MadCap:xref href="Inventory Posting Setup.htm#_Ref235267981" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Inventory Posting Setup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and <MadCap:xref href="Customers.htm#_Ref235267986" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Used as the default posting group information when creating the inventory posting setup during the automatic creation of customer locations.

Refer to topics <MadCap:xref href="Inventory Posting Setup.htm#_Ref235267981" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Inventory Posting Setup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and <MadCap:xref href="Customers.htm#_Ref235267986" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Def. In-Transit Location Code

Used as the default in-transit location when creating transfer routes during the automatic creation of customer locations (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Customers.htm#_Ref235267993" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Used as the default in-transit location when creating transfer routes during the automatic creation of customer locations (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Customers.htm#_Ref235267993" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Rental Service Contract Tmpl.
Used as the default template during the automatic creation of rental service contracts and drives the Update Rental Contract Prices periodic activity.

seg-source.mrk: Used as the default template during the automatic creation of rental service contracts and drives the Update Rental Contract Prices periodic activity.

trans-unit.source: External Rental Loc. Code
Used as location code for 3rd Party Rental.

seg-source.mrk: Used as location code for 3rd Party Rental.

trans-unit.source: Insert Rate Components
The content of this field determines when Rate Components are inserted for an item. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: The content of this field determines when Rate Components are inserted for an item.

trans-unit.source: Always – Rate Components are inserted if a Rate Component exists.

seg-source.mrk: Always – Rate Components are inserted if a Rate Component exists.

trans-unit.source: When Price exists – Rate Components are inserted only when the Component and its rent price exist for an item.

seg-source.mrk: When Price exists – Rate Components are inserted only when the Component and its rent price exist for an item.

trans-unit.source: Req. Wksh. Template Name
Used when creating a Requisition from a Rent Order (alternative supply).

seg-source.mrk: Used when creating a Requisition from a Rent Order (alternative supply).

trans-unit.source: Requisition Wksh. Name
Used when creating a Requisition from a Rent Order (alternative supply).

seg-source.mrk: Used when creating a Requisition from a Rent Order (alternative supply).

trans-unit.source: Ext. Doc. No. Mandatory
If selected, requires the existence of an external document number on a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, requires the existence of an external document number on a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: NOTE
This requirement only applies to Shipment and Return processing.

seg-source.mrk: This requirement only applies to Shipment and Return processing.

trans-unit.source: Deposit Handling
XXXX
Deposit Journal Template Name
XXXX
Deposit Journal Batch Name
XXXX
Numbering FastTab
On this FastTab, number series for the cc|rental master data and documents are defined.

seg-source.mrk: On this FastTab, number series for the cc|rental master data and documents are defined.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Mgt. Setup page, Numbering FastTab
The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Rent Contract Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Orders (Rental Contract).

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Orders (Rental Contract).

trans-unit.source: Rent Quote Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Quotes.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Quotes.

trans-unit.source: Rent Reservation Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Reservation.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Reservation.

trans-unit.source: Service Contract Nos.
Number Series to be used to create the Service Contracts with the Document Type of Rental Contract, which are automatically created for the invoicing of rent positions.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create the Service Contracts with the Document Type of Rental Contract, which are automatically created for the invoicing of rent positions.

trans-unit.source: Contract Invoice Nos.
Number Series to be used to create un-posted invoices from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create un-posted invoices from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Contract Credit Memo Nos.
Number Series to be used to create un-posted credit memos from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create un-posted credit memos from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Posted Invoice Nos.
Number Series to be used to create Posted Invoices from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create Posted Invoices from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Posted Credit Memo Nos.
Number Series to be used to create Posted Credit Memos from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create Posted Credit Memos from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Posted Shipment Nos.
Number Series to be used to create Posted Shipments from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create Posted Shipments from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Posted Rental Return Nos.
Number Series to be used to create Posted Returns from a Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create Posted Returns from a Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Posted Rent Return Nos.
Number Series to be used to create Posted Returns from a 3rd Party Purchase Order.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used to create Posted Returns from a 3rd Party Purchase Order.

trans-unit.source: Prepaid Posting Document Nos.
Number Series to be used in the General Ledger Entries when the Post Prepaid Rent Entries report is run.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used in the General Ledger Entries when the Post Prepaid Rent Entries report is run.

trans-unit.source: Leasing Agreement Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Lease Agreements.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Lease Agreements.

trans-unit.source: Rent Item Sales Order Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of XXX

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of XXX

trans-unit.source: Rent Deposit Nos.
Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Deposits.

seg-source.mrk: Number Series to be used for the enumeration of Rent Deposits.

trans-unit.source: Hour Based Rental FastTab
On this FastTab, defaults for hour--based invoicing are defined.

seg-source.mrk: On this FastTab, defaults for hour--based invoicing are defined.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Mgt. Setup page, Hour Based Rental FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Setup page, Hour Based Rental FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Start Time of Working Day
Indicates the default start time of each working day.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the default start time of each working day.

trans-unit.source: End Time of Working Day
Indicates the default end time of each working day.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the default end time of each working day.

trans-unit.source: Hour Rounding Precision

Indicates the hourly rounding precision; uses an hour calculation. Therefore, if 65 minutes is entered in the field, it changes to 1 hour and 5 minutes. If only 65 is entered in the field, it changes to 2 days 17 hours.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the hourly rounding precision; uses an hour calculation.
Therefore, if 65 minutes is entered in the field, it changes to 1 hour and 5 minutes.
If only 65 is entered in the field, it changes to 2 days 17 hours.

trans-unit.source: Note
Decimal entries, such as .25 to represent 15 minutes, are prohibited. To round to the nearest 15 minutes, enter 15 min (or minutes) in the field.

seg-source.mrk: Decimal entries, such as .25 to represent 15 minutes, are prohibited.
To round to the nearest 15 minutes, enter 15 min (or minutes) in the field.

trans-unit.source: Hour Rounding Direction
Indicates the direction of the hourly rounding, based on the Hour Rounding Precision field. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the direction of the hourly rounding, based on the Hour Rounding Precision field.

trans-unit.source:
5|4 – rounds the hourly value up or down to the nearest value as follows:
  • the rounding digit is rounded up one digit if the digit to the right is greater than or equal to 5.
  • the rounding digit is rounded down one digit if the digit to the right is less than 5.

seg-source.mrk: 5|4 – rounds the hourly value up or down to the nearest value as follows:
• the rounding digit is rounded up one digit if the digit to the right is greater than or equal to 5.
• the rounding digit is rounded down one digit if the digit to the right is less than 5.

trans-unit.source: Up – hourly values are rounded up to the nearest value.

seg-source.mrk: Up – hourly values are rounded up to the nearest value.

trans-unit.source: Down – hourly values are rounded down to the nearest value.

seg-source.mrk: Down – hourly values are rounded down to the nearest value.

trans-unit.source: Values FastTab
The Values FastTab contains the Enable Zero Amount Invoicing field, which determines whether zero amount invoicing is permitted in the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: The Values FastTab contains the Enable Zero Amount Invoicing field, which determines whether zero amount invoicing is permitted in the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Mgt. Setup page, Values FastTab
Refer to topic XX for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic XX for more information.

trans-unit.source: Product Version Information
On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

trans-unit.source: : Product version information accessed by clicking About on the ribbon

seg-source.mrk: : Product version information accessed by clicking About on the ribbon

trans-unit.source: Rate Codes
cc|rental uses a period of time for which a price is to be entered. For this period of time, a Rate Code has to be set up to which a period (day, month, week, and so on) must be assigned.

seg-source.mrk: cc|rental uses a period of time for which a price is to be entered.
For this period of time, a Rate Code has to be set up to which a period (day, month, week, and so on) must be assigned.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Rate Codes page
The fields in this page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in this page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Code
Unique identifier for the rental rate.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier for the rental rate.

trans-unit.source: Type
Period of time that must consist of days; hours or minutes cannot be used for rental rates.

seg-source.mrk: Period of time that must consist of days; hours or minutes cannot be used for rental rates.

trans-unit.source: Description
Short description of the rental rate code.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the rental rate code.

trans-unit.source: Rental Rate Code
If selected, this code can be used as a rental rate. This check box is automatically selected.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, this code can be used as a rental rate.
This check box is automatically selected.

trans-unit.source: Rent Rate Components

To enable the invoicing of amounts that are related to the rental of items but have to be reported as separate positions, cc|rental offers the use of Rate Components. This can be a G/L Account as well as a Resource and has a specific Price for each Rate.

seg-source.mrk: To enable the invoicing of amounts that are related to the rental of items but have to be reported as separate positions, cc|rental offers the use of Rate Components.
This can be a G/L Account as well as a Resource and has a specific Price for each Rate.

trans-unit.source: Rate Components are divided into two groups:

seg-source.mrk: Rate Components are divided into two groups:

trans-unit.source: Rate Part – Invoiced periodically.
One-Time Invoicing – Invoiced once at the beginning, end or a selected time of a renting period.

seg-source.mrk: One-Time Invoicing – Invoiced once at the beginning, end or a selected time of a renting period.

trans-unit.source: Rate Components are inserted to the Rent Order automatically after entering the item number.

seg-source.mrk: Rate Components are inserted to the Rent Order automatically after entering the item number.

trans-unit.source: :<MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-05T11:34:45.5203205-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="2017 SP1 question:\r\nShould we include the Usage field here? Is the setup required for all RR Components now? Are the selections in the SP1 screen shot valid?" MadCap:editor="NTadajewski0100" MadCap:editDate="2018-08-24T11:01:29.4964287-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd"> Rent Rate Components page</MadCap:annotation>

seg-source.mrk: :<MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-05T11:34:45.5203205-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="2017 SP1 question:\r\nShould we include the Usage field here? Is the setup required for all RR Components now? Are the selections in the SP1 screen shot valid?" MadCap:editor="NTadajewski0100" MadCap:editDate="2018-08-24T11:01:29.4964287-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd"> Rent Rate Components page</MadCap:annotation>

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Rent Rate Components page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Rent Rate Components page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Type
Identifies the type of rate component. The options are Rate Part and One-Time Invoicing.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the type of rate component.
The options are Rate Part and One-Time Invoicing.

trans-unit.source: No.
Unique identifier for the rate component.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier for the rate component.

trans-unit.source: Description
Short description of the rate component.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the rate component.

trans-unit.source: Gen. Prod. Posting Group
General Product Posting Group that will be used when inserting the rate component to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: General Product Posting Group that will be used when inserting the rate component to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: VAT Prod. Posting Group
VAT Product Posting Group that will be used when inserting the rate component to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: VAT Product Posting Group that will be used when inserting the rate component to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: Search Description
Search Description for the rate component.

seg-source.mrk: Search Description for the rate component.

trans-unit.source: Invoicing at

Determines whether a One-Time Invoicing rate component is invoiced on shipment, on return of the related item, or a selected time during the rental period. The options are Start of Rental, End of Rental, and Selected.

seg-source.mrk: Determines whether a One-Time Invoicing rate component is invoiced on shipment, on return of the related item, or a selected time during the rental period.
The options are Start of Rental, End of Rental, and Selected.

trans-unit.source: Usage
Identifies how the rate component is used. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Identifies how the rate component is used.

trans-unit.source: <blank>

Insurance – used with the Self-Insured Customer function, which prevents the addition of the rent component to the rental contract line if the customer is set up as Self-Insured (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Self-Insured Customers.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Self-Insured Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Insurance – used with the Self-Insured Customer function, which prevents the addition of the rent component to the rental contract line if the customer is set up as Self-Insured (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Self-Insured Customers.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Self-Insured Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: VAT
Fees
Surcharges
Failure Types

When an event – such as planned maintenance – prevents a customer from using a rental item, a failure can be processed on the rent order line. When the “Enter Failure” function is run, Failure Types direct how the failure is to be processed.

seg-source.mrk: When an event – such as planned maintenance – prevents a customer from using a rental item, a failure can be processed on the rent order line.
When the “Enter Failure” function is run, Failure Types direct how the failure is to be processed.

trans-unit.source: : Failure Types page
The fields in the Failure Types page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Failure Types page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Failure Type Code
Unique identifier for the failure type.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier for the failure type.

trans-unit.source: Description
Short description of the failure type.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the failure type.

trans-unit.source: Credit Memo
If selected, a credit memo will be created for the period specified on the Rental Failure Card.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, a credit memo will be created for the period specified on the Rental Failure Card.

trans-unit.source: Discount %
Percentage of the amount to be credited.

seg-source.mrk: Percentage of the amount to be credited.

trans-unit.source: Reduce Free Counter
Determines if the calculated free counter is reduced when a specific type of failure is entered. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the calculated free counter is reduced when a specific type of failure is entered.

trans-unit.source: <blank> – the counter is not reduced for the failure type.

seg-source.mrk: <blank> – the counter is not reduced for the failure type.

trans-unit.source: <Full> – the counter is reduced completely for the failure type.

seg-source.mrk: <Full> – the counter is reduced completely for the failure type.

trans-unit.source: <Percent> – the counter is reduced the same as the discounted percentage for the failure type.

seg-source.mrk: <Percent> – the counter is reduced the same as the discounted percentage for the failure type.

trans-unit.source: <MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-05T14:29:55.1804023-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="New 2017 SP1 \r\n\r\nAlso, please check if the data in the screen shot is valid." MadCap:editor="NTadajewski0100" MadCap:editDate="2018-08-24T11:04:01.2690859-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Rental Preconditions</MadCap:annotation>

mrk.bpt: <MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-05T14:29:55.1804023-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="New 2017 SP1 \r\n\r\nAlso, please check if the data in the screen shot is valid." MadCap:editor="NTadajewski0100" MadCap:editDate="2018-08-24T11:04:01.2690859-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">

trans-unit.source: Prior to completing a rental shipment, some items may have preconditions that must be met to drive or operate a rented machine. In the Rental Preconditions page, the types of preconditions are defined.

seg-source.mrk: Prior to completing a rental shipment, some items may have preconditions that must be met to drive or operate a rented machine.
In the Rental Preconditions page, the types of preconditions are defined.

trans-unit.source: : Rental Preconditions
The fields in the Rental Preconditions page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Rental Preconditions page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Code
Unique identifier for the rental precondition.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier for the rental precondition.

trans-unit.source: Description
Short description of the rental precondition.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the rental precondition.

trans-unit.source: Action Type
Indicates if the precondition requires a type of confirmation (Confirmation) or is only a message to the customer (Message).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if the precondition requires a type of confirmation (Confirmation) or is only a message to the customer (Message).

trans-unit.source: If a precondition has been defined for a confirmation, a Name or Name and Date of Birth must be entered before the shipment can be posted. Precondition messages appear prior to posting but require no action.

seg-source.mrk: If a precondition has been defined for a confirmation, a Name or Name and Date of Birth must be entered before the shipment can be posted.
Precondition messages appear prior to posting but require no action.

trans-unit.source: Confirmation Type
Determines if the person responsible for completing the precondition must provide a name or name and date of birth. This field is only used with Action Type = Confirmation.

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the person responsible for completing the precondition must provide a name or name and date of birth.
This field is only used with Action Type = Confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Minimum Age

Calculates the minimum age of the person responsible for completing the precondition. This field uses a date formula and is calculated by the Rental Start Date, <MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-06T13:01:59.4920693-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="need to explain this better. is it Rental Start Date - Minimum Age? Because if i enter 2/1/2001 for the date of birth, it shows as red. if i go with 1/31/2001, it's ok." MadCap:editor="NDOKS" MadCap:editDate="2017-10-06T13:03:06.4216333-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">e.g., if 16 years is the minimum age, then the date of birth entered must be 16 years before the Rental Start Date.</MadCap:annotation>

seg-source.mrk: Calculates the minimum age of the person responsible for completing the precondition.

This field uses a date formula and is calculated by the Rental Start Date, <MadCap:annotation MadCap:createDate="2017-10-06T13:01:59.4920693-05:00" MadCap:creator="NDOKS" MadCap:initials="ND" MadCap:comment="need to explain this better. is it Rental Start Date - Minimum Age? Because if i enter 2/1/2001 for the date of birth, it shows as red. if i go with 1/31/2001, it's ok." MadCap:editor="NDOKS" MadCap:editDate="2017-10-06T13:03:06.4216333-05:00" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">e.g., if 16 years is the minimum age, then the date of birth entered must be 16 years before the Rental Start Date.</MadCap:annotation>

trans-unit.source: This field is only used with Confirmation Type = Date of Birth.

seg-source.mrk: This field is only used with Confirmation Type = Date of Birth.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Item Shipment Preconditions.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Item Shipment Preconditions” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.
